metadata.title: Comprehensive Assessment Plan for Red Hat Device Edge - ISA/IEC 62443-4-2 SL-4

control-selections.description: All applicable controls for an SL-4 baseline for Red Hat Device Edge, covering SL-1 through SL-4.

assessment-activities.title: Assessment for CR-1.1 & RE(1,2): Human User Identification, Uniqueness, and MFA
assessment-activities.description: Assesses the procedural requirement for remote user access to the edge device fleet to be managed through a central, MFA-enabled Identity Provider.

steps.description: **Interview:** Interview the central IT/Security team to confirm that all SSH access to the edge device fleet is managed through a centralized Identity Provider (IdP) that enforces unique user identifiers and MFA.

**Test:** Attempt to SSH into a provisioned edge device using an account not managed by the central IdP. Verify the connection is refused. Attempt to SSH with a valid account and verify an MFA challenge is presented.

assessment-activities.title: Assessment for CR-1.2 & RE(1): Software Process and Device Identification
assessment-activities.description: Assesses how software processes (pods) are uniquely identified by MicroShift.

steps.description: **Examine:** Inspect the manifests in the GitOps repository that define the application workloads. For a sample application, verify it is configured to use a unique, non-default ServiceAccount.

assessment-activities.title: Assessment for CR-1.5 & RE(1): Authenticator Management and Hardware Security
assessment-activities.description: Assesses how the RHEL for Edge host protects authenticators using disk encryption, optionally backed by a TPM.

steps.description: **Examine:** Review the Image Builder blueprint used to create the RHEL for Edge OS image. Verify that it is configured to use LUKS full-disk encryption, optionally bound to a TPMv2 device.
**Test:** On a provisioned edge device, run `lsblk` and verify that the root filesystem is mounted on a `luks` device.

assessment-activities.title: Assessment for CR-2.1 & RE(1,2,3,4): Authorization and Dual Approval
assessment-activities.description: Assesses MicroShift RBAC and the procedural dual-approval workflow for edge deployments.

steps.description: **Examine:** Review the `RoleBinding` and `ClusterRoleBinding` manifests in the GitOps repository to verify permissions are granted based on ServiceAccounts.
**Examine:** Review the branch protection rules in the Git repository to ensure merges to the main branch require peer review from a designated approvals team.

assessment-activities.title: Assessment for CR-2.8: Auditable Events
assessment-activities.description: Assesses the host's audit logging configuration and forwarding to a central SIEM.

steps.description: **Examine:** Review the Image Builder blueprint to verify that the `auditd` service is enabled and configured with the appropriate rules. Examine the configuration of the log forwarding agent (e.g., Fluentd) to verify it sends logs to the central SIEM.

**Test:** Trigger a failed SSH login attempt to an edge device. Search the central SIEM for the corresponding `sshd` audit log event and verify the source IP, timestamp, and user are correctly recorded.

assessment-activities.title: Assessment for CR-3.4 & RE(1,2): Software and Information Integrity
assessment-activities.description: Assesses the integrity of the immutable OS and runtime configuration.

steps.description: **Examine:** Review the Image Builder blueprint to verify the inclusion of AIDE for boot-time integrity checking.

**Test:** On a running edge device, run `rpm-ostree status` to verify there are no unauthorized local changes. Attempt to install a package using `dnf` and verify the operation is blocked by the immutable file system.

assessment-activities.title: Assessment for CR-4.3: Use of Cryptography (FIPS)
assessment-activities.description: Assesses if the RHEL for Edge OS image is built with FIPS mode enabled.

steps.description: **Examine:** Review the Image Builder blueprint to verify that the `fips-mode-setup --enable` command is part of the image build process.
**Test:** On a provisioned edge device, run `fips-mode-setup --check` and verify the output indicates FIPS mode is enabled.

assessment-activities.title: Assessment for SAR-2.4 & RE(1): Mobile Code (Image Policy)
assessment-activities.description: Assesses enforcement of trusted container image policies within MicroShift.

steps.description: **Examine:** Review the MicroShift configuration files in the GitOps repository to verify that image signature verification is enabled and points to the organization's trusted container registry.

**Test:** Attempt to deploy a pod on an edge device using an unsigned container image or an image from an untrusted registry. Verify that MicroShift's CRI-O runtime rejects the image and the pod fails to start.

assessment-activities.title: Assessment for CR-5.1: Network Segmentation
assessment-activities.description: Assesses the implementation of host-level firewalls and network policies.

steps.description: **Examine:** Review the Image Builder blueprint to verify that `firewalld` is enabled and configured with a default-deny policy. Examine the `NetworkPolicy` manifests in the GitOps repository for MicroShift workloads.

**Test:** From an external machine, attempt to connect to a non-essential port on the edge device and verify the connection is blocked by `firewalld`. From a test pod, attempt to connect to a service in another namespace and verify the `NetworkPolicy` blocks the traffic.

assessment-activities.title: Assessment for CR-7.7: Least Functionality
assessment-activities.description: Assesses the minimal package set of the RHEL for Edge OS image.

steps.description: **Examine:** Review the package list in the Image Builder blueprint. Verify that it only includes essential packages required for the OS and MicroShift to function, and that no unnecessary services (e.g., `cockpit`, `sendmail`) are included.

assessment-activities.title: Assessment of Compensating Controls
assessment-activities.description: Assesses compensating controls for requirements not met by the software/OS.

steps.description: **Interview:** Interview the physical security team to discuss the measures in place for protecting devices in potentially insecure edge locations (e.g., locked, tamper-evident enclosures).
**Interview:** Interview an infrastructure engineer to confirm that UEFI Secure Boot is enabled in the BIOS for all edge device hardware.
**Interview:** Interview the facilities team to discuss the power resiliency measures for critical edge locations (e.g., battery backups, UPS).
